name: Verify if User Guide is available on Home Page as Agency User
folder: UNO-200, UNO-1394 User Guide on Home Page
testScript: {"step":[{"$":{"index":"0"},"customFields":"","description":"Login to WWW.Venneu-dev.com as Agency User","expectedResult":"Successful log in and should land on Home page"},{"$":{"index":"1"},"customFields":"","description":"In Homepage Click the Help Icon at top of the page","expectedResult":"Page should navigate to Help Section on the Home Page"},{"$":{"index":"2"},"customFields":"","description":"Click on User Guides on the Help Section","expectedResult":"Agency User Guide Should open as a PDF."},{"$":{"index":"3"},"customFields":"","description":"Repeat step 1,2,3 on Firefox","expectedResult":"All expected outcome should be achieved"},{"$":{"index":"4"},"customFields":"","description":"Repeat step 1,2,3 on IE","expectedResult":"All expected outcome should be achieved"}]}
justification: Checks non-critical functionality (User Guide availability), involves simple navigation and verification, minimal business impact, less integration complexity as it is focused on documentation access.

name: Verify that the changes to column names on the Agency BAC export.
testScript:
Given :
  • Logged on as a Neuven,  with View invoices or Manage invoices permission.
When:
  • On the invoices , Agency BACS export page
Then:
  • The column name for Account Number has been changed to : Account Number/IBAN .
  • The column name for Sort Code has been changed to : Sort Code/BIC Code .
justification: Tests display and naming conventions in UI, involves multiple components.

name: Verify if the Agency is outside of the UK Account number and sort code are not to be displayed
justification: Covers visibility conditions based on user input, involves financial data.

name: Verify if the Agency is outside of the UK, IBAN field is to be displayed and BIC field to be displayed
justification: Covers visibility conditions based on user input, involves financial data.

name: Verify if edit Is selected, on the additional details tab if the Agency is outside of the UK if the Agency is outside of the UK Account number and sort code are not to be displayed
justification: Covers visibility conditions based on user input, involves financial data.

name: Verify if edit Is selected, on the additional details tab if the Agency is outside of the UK, IBAN field is to be displayed and BIC field to be displayed
justification: Covers visibility conditions based on user input, involves financial data.

name: Verify GB code is to be based on the country that the Agency is set to
justification: Verifies condition based on user input and country selection.

name: Verify if a new agency branch is created, on the additional details tab if the Agency is outside of the UK, IBAN field is to be displayed and BIC field to be displayed
justification: Covers visibility conditions based on user input, involves financial data.

name: Verify filters in the Authorize Rate Adjustments page
objective: User should be able to filter the data on the Authorize rate adjustment page using advance filter options and the system should not throw an AJAX error while using the filters.
testScript:
{"step":[{"$":{"index":"0"},"customFields":"","description":"Log in as neuven user in www.venneu-dev.com","expectedResult":"Successful log in and User should see the Home page","testData":"Adhi.bommanapally@neuven.co.uk
Welcome.1"},{"$":{"index":"1"},"customFields":"","description":"From home page navigate to rates on the left panel and choose Authorise Rate adjustments from the drop down","expectedResult":"User should be taken to Authorize rate adjustment page and also should be able to see the list of all the adjusted rates that are waiting to be authorised"},{"$":{"index":"2"},"customFields":"","description":"Click on the search Icon on the right corner","expectedResult":"User should be able to see the individual search boxes above each column"},{"$":{"index":"3"},"customFields":"","description":"Filter data by entering values in the search boxes individually","expectedResult":"Data shown should be filtered and shown to the user based on the key words in the search box"},{"$":{"index":"4"},"customFields":"","description":"Verify by filtering data by entering values in multiple search boxes.","expectedResult":"Data should be filtered according to multiple filters that are used"},{"$":{"index":"5"},"customFields":"","description":"Verify by adding values to all the search boxes","expectedResult":"Data should still correspond based on the data entered."},{"$":{"index":"6"},"customFields":"","description":"Export the filtered data by clicking on the export icon on the right corner","expectedResult":"Data on the exported file should match and correspond to the data shown on the screen after filtering"},{"$":{"index":"7"},"customFields":"","description":"Repeat Steps 1 to 7 in IE and firefox browser","expectedResult":"All expected results should be achieved"}]}
justification: This test verifies filters' functionality, which affects data display but does not have a critical business impact. It involves data manipulation and UI consistency, but less critical compared to core booking or rate export functionalities.

Welcome.1"},{"$":{"index":"1"},"customFields":"","description":"From home page navigate to rates on the left panel and choose Rate Creation from the drop down","expectedResult":"User should be taken to Rate Creation page and also should be able to see rate creation tab and  list of rates at the bottom"},{"$":{"index":"2"},"customFields":"","description":"Click on the search Icon on the right corner ","expectedResult":"User should be able to see the individual search boxes above each column"},{"$":{"index":"3"},"customFields":"","description":"Filter data by entering values in the search boxes individually","expectedResult":"Data shown should be filtered and shown to the user based on the key words in the search box"},{"$":{"index":"4"},"customFields":"","description":"Verify by filtering data by entering values in multiple search boxes.","expectedResult":"Data should be filtered according to multiple filters that are used"},{"$":{"index":"5"},"customFields":"","description":"Verify by adding values to all the search boxes","expectedResult":"Data should still correspond based on the data entered."},{"$":{"index":"6"},"customFields":"","description":"Export the filtered data by clicking on the export icon on the right corner","expectedResult":"Data on the exported file should match and correspond to the data shown on the screen after filtering"},{"$":{"index":"7"},"customFields":"","description":"Repeat Steps 1 to 7 in IE and firefox browser","expectedResult":"All expected results should be achieved"}]}
justification: This test focuses on filtering data during rate creation. It covers data manipulation but doesn't meet the critical business process criteria. It involves multiple steps but is less critical compared to rate validation or export functionalities.

name: Verify filters in the Rate Management Page
objective: User should be able to filter the data on the RateManagement page using advance filter options and the system should not throw an AJAX error while using the filters.
testScript:
{"step":[{"$":{"index":"0"},"customFields":"","description":"Log in as neuven user in www.venneu-dev.com","expectedResult":"Successful log in and User should see the Home page","testData":"Adhi.bommanapally@neuven.co.uk
Welcome.1"},{"$":{"index":"1"},"customFields":"","description":"From home page navigate to rates on the left panel and choose Rate Management from the drop down","expectedResult":"User should be taken to Rate Management page and should be able to see list of all rates"},{"$":{"index":"2"},"customFields":"","description":"Click on the search Icon on the right corner ","expectedResult":"User should be able to see the individual search boxes above each column"},{"$":{"index":"3"},"customFields":"","description":"Filter data by entering values in the search boxes individually","expectedResult":"Data shown should be filtered and shown to the user based on the key words in the search box"},{"$":{"index":"4"},"customFields":"","description":"Verify by filtering data by entering values in multiple search boxes.","expectedResult":"Data should be filtered according to multiple filters that are used"},{"$":{"index":"5"},"customFields":"","description":"Verify by adding values to all the search boxes","expectedResult":"Data should still correspond based on the data entered."},{"$":{"index":"6"},"customFields":"","description":"Export the filtered data by clicking on the export icon on the right corner","expectedResult":"Data on the exported file should match and correspond to the data shown on the screen after filtering"},{"$":{"index":"7"},"customFields":"","description":"Repeat Steps 1 to 7 in IE and firefox browser","expectedResult":"All expected results should be achieved"}]}
justification: This test covers filtering data in the rate management page. It involves data manipulation and UI consistency but lacks high business impact compared to core functionalities like booking or rate validation.

name: Verify that the Expiry Date is taken from the Documents Maintenance Page and is displayed in the format DD/MM/YYYY
justification: This test case involves data display and formatting, which is important but does not involve multiple components, user roles, or complex processes. Therefore, it meets only the complexity and critical business process criteria.

name: Verify that when View is clicked, the pop is to appear of the document
justification: This test case ensures the functionality of viewing documents, a basic feature with moderate impact but does not cover multiple components or complex processes. It meets the critical business process and integration points criteria.

name: Verify that in the Action Column, where there is an upload for the document type, green tick = verified document
justification: This is relevant to document verification, which is a common task but not particularly complex or broad in coverage. It meets the critical process and basic integration criteria.

name: Verify in the Action Column, when the green tick is clicked, the tick and ‘x’ will be replaced by the word ‘Verified’
justification: This test is more focused on the UI interaction and display updates which are important for user experience but not critical at a system level. It meets the UI validation and user interaction criteria.

name: Verify that when the Rex ‘X’ is clicked, the tick and ‘x’ will be removed and replaced by the word ‘Rejected’
justification: This test is about UI interaction and display changes. It's important but not critical. It meets UI validation and user interaction criteria.

name: Verify that the document type is a dropdown box.
testScript:
Given: 

  • Logged in as an Agency User 

When: 

  • On the worker’s page 

Then:  

  • The document type is a drop-down list which I populated from the Document Type Name Maintenance
justification: Ensuring the correct control type is important for UI consistency but less critical in terms of system functionality. It meets critical process and UI validation criteria.

name: Verify that the table displays Document Type
justification: Verifying display features is important but has less business impact and complexity. It meets critical process and UI validation criteria.

name: Verify that the table displays File Name
justification: Verifying display features is important but has less business impact and complexity. It meets critical process and UI validation criteria.

name: Verify that the table displays View hyperlink
justification: Ensuring hyperlinks are displayed correctly affects navigation but is a basic functionality. It meets critical process and UI validation criteria.

name: Verify that the Verified column is no longer appearing on the table
justification: This involves ensuring proper display of table columns, which is significant for UI but not deeply impacting the system. It meets critical process and UI validation criteria.

name: Verify that the expiry date is displayed on the table
justification: Verification of data display (expiry date) is important but less complex. It meets critical process and data manipulation criteria.

name: Verify that the expiry date displays the expiry date in red and if no expiry date was selected, N/A is displayed
justification: Additional formatting and data display checks improve user experience but are not critical. It meets critical process and data manipulation criteria.

name: Verify that the Mandatory column is on the table
justification: Ensuring the presence of critical UI elements (mandatory column) for data verification. It meets critical process and UI validation criteria.

name: Verify that if the document type was marked mandatory in the defaults documents page, yes is displayed
justification: Verification of mandatory field marking is important but has lower complexity and integration. It meets critical process and data manipulation criteria.

name: Verify that if the document type was not marked mandatory in the defaults documents page, no is displayed or it is left empty
justification: This test checks for non-critical validation related to UI fields. It is important but does not involve core business processes, integrations, or security.

name: Verify that date of upload is displayed on the table
justification: This test verifies a display element which is important for user interaction but not critical to core functionality, security, or calculations.

name: Verify jobtype dropdown defaults to all jobtypes on initial load
justification: This test addresses default settings which are important but not critical to core functionality or security.

name: Verify tier 1 is defaulted to Immediate
justification: Default settings check which is important but not critical. Verifies user expectation for default configurations.

name: Verify the name of columns in Auto cascade table
justification: Naming and labeling are important for clarity but do not affect core functionality or security.

name: Verify there is an error message when no auto cascade details are filled
justification: This test case ensures error handling but does not cover critical business processes or integrations.

name: Verify as a NEUVEN user the input fields in the add direct worker -user details tab
testScript:
Given:

  • Logged in as a Neuven user with ‘Manage Direct Bank Worker’ permission.

When: 

  • On the direct bank workers page > Click ‘Add New Direct Bank Worker’ button

Then:

  • User is redirected to a page to crate a new direct bank worker.

  • One the page there is the following fields. 

    • A drop or click to upload a worker image. 

    • An input filed for first name 

    • An input field for last name 

    • An input field for email 

    • Address line one 

    • Address line two 

    • Town 

    • Postcode

    • Country

    • Date of birth 

    • Gender

    • Toggles for approved and locked out. 

  • The place holder on all the input field will indicate what is expected in each field.
justification: The test case ensures the UI elements are present and correctly labeled for critical user management functionality but does not verify data integrity or security aspects.

name: Verify as a CLIENT user the input fields in the add direct worker -user details tab
testScript:
Given:

  • Logged in as a Client user with ‘Edit Direct Bank Worker’ permission.

When:
  • On the direct bank workers page > Click ‘Add New Direct Bank Worker’ button
Then:
  • User is redirected to a page to crate a new direct bank worker.
  • One the page there is the following fields. 
    • A drop or click to upload a worker image. 
    • An input filed for first name 
    • An input field for last name 
    • An input field for email 
    • Address line one 
    • Address line two 
    • Town 
    • Postcode
    • Country
    • Date of birth 
    • Gender
    • Toggles for approved and locked out. 
  • The place holder on all the input field will indicate what is expected in each field.
justification: Similar to UNO-T378, this checks for the presence and correctness of UI fields for a client user but doesn't delve into deeper functional or security checks.

name: Verify that a NEUVEN can see the Locations tab when creating a new direct worker profile.
testScript:
Given :

  • Logged in as a Neuven user with ‘Manage Direct Bank Worker’ permission

When :
  • On the direct bank works page > click add new bank worker > On the client locations tab
Then :
  • Page will show a table for the list of client locations for the worker profile 
  • The available columns will include:
    • Client location 
    • Address
    • Post code
    • Miles (distance between worker postcode and location postcode)
    • linked (tick box)
    • tier one 1 and tier 2
justification: Checks visibility of the Locations tab, an important part of the UI but does not test deeper functional integrity or data interactions.

name: Verify that a Client can see the Locations tab when creating a new direct worker profile.
testScript:
Given :

  • Logged in as a Client user with ‘Edit Direct Bank Worker’ Permission

When :
  • On the direct bank works page > click add new bank worker > On the client locations tab
Then :
  • Page will show a table for the list of client locations for the worker profile 
  • The available columns will include:
    • Client location 
    • Address
    • Post code
    • Miles (distance between worker postcode and location postcode)
    • linked (tick box)
    • tier one 1 and tier 2
justification: Ensures visibility of the Locations tab for client users, a key UI check but not substantial in data handling or security.

name: Verify as a NEUVEN user when creating a new direct bank worker the default permission on the permissions tab for login via app or website.
testScript:
Given:
  • Logged in as a Neuven user (With Manage Direct Bank Workers Permission)
When:
  • Direct Bank Worker page
Then:

  • Permissions Tab

    • There will be options for the following logins. 

      • Log in Via Venneu App (Default)

      • Log in Via Venneu Desktop Site

  • When setting up a Direct bank worker ‘Log in Via Venneu App’ permission is ticked by default. 

  • The “Log in via Venneu Desktop Site” is not ticked
justification: Covers permissions aspect, minor security and business process impact, not as critical or complex compared to other tests.

name: Verify as a Client User when creating a new direct bank worker the default permission on the permissions tab for login via app or website.
testScript:
Given:

  • Logged in as a Client user with ‘Edit Direct Bank Worker’ permission

When:
  • Direct Bank Worker page
Then:

  • Permissions Tab

    • There will be options for the following logins. 

      • Log in Via Venneu App (Default)

      • Log in Via Venneu Desktop Site

  • When setting up a Direct bank worker ‘Log in Via Venneu App’ permission is ticked by default. 

  • The “Log in via Venneu Desktop Site” is not ticked
justification: Similar to Neuven user permissions test, low business impact and security relevance.

name: Verify as a NEUVEN User that the DBS details on the Compliance tab appear below the RTW details.
testScript:
Given: 

  • Logged in as a Neuven user with ‘Manage Direct Bank worker Permission'

When :
  • One direct Bank Workers Page
  • When adding a  New Direct Bank worker
Then:

  • One the Compliance Tab

    • DBS Details 

      • DBS Certificate Verified Toggle

      • DBS Certificate Verified By (Free Type Text field)

      • DBS Certificate Verified On (Helper text with Date format DD/MM/YYYY)

        • Date picker

      • DBS Certificate Number (Free Type Text field)

      • DBS Issue Date (Helper text with Date format DD/MM/YYYY)

        • Date picker

  • These fields are editable by users with above permission only
justification: Focuses on UI arrangement and field placements, less critical for business impact and security, lower priority compared to other tests.

name: Verify as a NEUVEN user that there is a View Document Agreement History Button on the Direct Bank profile.
testScript:
Given:

  • Logged in as a Neuven user with ‘Manage Direct Bank worker Permission'

When:

  • Click Add New Direct Bank worker / edit a Direct Worker Profile

Then: 

  • On the Compliance Tab

  • There is a ‘View Document Agreement History’ Button

  • This Links to the T&C agreed via the APP

  • when this is clicked a Pop up appears  showing  details of the document agreed

  • The heading on the pop up will display :  - User Document Agreement History - ‘'Worker Name’'

  • On the Terms and Conditions popup the is a table at the bottom of the table that shows

    • Version (Show Version Number)

    • Agreement Date (Show date and time of Agreement)

  • Close Button
justification: Checks the visibility and functionality of a specific button. Important for UI validation but less critical compared to data manipulation or security tests.

name: Verify as a CLIENT user that there is a View Document Agreement History Button on the Direct Bank profile.
testScript:
Given:
  • Client user with ' Edit Direct Bank Worker Permission'

When:

  • Click Add New Direct Bank worker / edit a Direct Worker Profile

Then: 

  • On the Compliance Tab

  • There is a ‘View Document Agreement History’ Button

  • This Links to the T&C agreed via the APP

  • when this is clicked a Pop up appears  showing  details of the document agreed

  • The heading on the pop up will display :  - User Document Agreement History - ‘'Worker Name’'

  • On the Terms and Conditions popup the is a table at the bottom of the table that shows

    • Version (Show Version Number)

    • Agreement Date (Show date and time of Agreement)

  • Close Button
justification: Similar to UNO-T437, checks UI functionality for a specific button for client users, important but lower criticality.

name: Verify adding Add Direct Bank worker Document tab to Worker Document Maintenance Page when logged in as a NEUVEN user.
testScript:
Given:
  • Logged in as a Neuven user 
When:

  • Administration

  • Worker Document Maintenance page

Then: 

  • Verify that there is a new tab called : Direct Bank Worker Documents Types
justification: Checks the presence of a new tab, important for UI consistency but less complex compared to data logic or security tests.

name: As a NEUVEN user the client drop down function works on the Direct Bank worker Document Tab - Table in the Worker Document Maintenance Page
testScript:
Given:

  • Logged in as a Neuven User

When on the: 

  • Document Upload Maintenance Page

  • Direct Bank Worker Document Types Tab

Then:

  • The table displayed show the following columns 

  • The Initial load of the page will show documents for all clients.

  • There will be a filter on the to select a specific client using a dropdown function. 

  • When a specific client is selected only the information relevant to that client will show.
justification: Tests a specific dropdown functionality, important for UI interactions but less critical compared to data integrity or security-focused tests.

name: Verify that the sleep-in shift can be created for the whole shift
justification: This test case checks the creation of a specific type of shift, involves business logic for shift management, and covers a moderately complex process.

name: Verify that the sleep-in shift can be created for part of the shift
justification: This test case checks the partial creation of a specific type of shift, involves business logic for shift management, and covers a moderately complex process.

name: Verify that the sleep-in shift displays (sleep in & times) for both Client & Agency
justification: This test case checks the display of shift information for different entities, involves user interface elements and business logic, and covers a moderately complex process.

name: Verify that reason code is not filled out
justification: This test case checks a specific validation rule, involves business logic for reason codes, and has lower complexity and business impact.

name: Verify that status of the booking will be Select workers
justification: This test case checks a specific status update in the booking process, involves business logic for status transitions, and has lower complexity and business impact.

name: Verify that the Neuven user can select and agency from the dropdown list on the Agency Workers Page.
testScript:
Given :
  • Logged on as a Neuven User.
When :
  • On the agency workers page.
Then :
  • User can select any of the agencies from the drop down on the top of the page.
  • One the agency has been selected the table in the second part  of the screen will populate.
  • Check that that list is only showing the works that are assigned to that agency.
justification: Primarily covers user interface and permissions, touching on business process. Less critical compared to others.

name: Verify that a Neuven User can search the advanced generic search file for the DOB of a worker.
testScript:
Given :
  • Logged on as a Neuven User.
When :
  • On the agency workers page.
Then :
  • Using the generic advanced search option, the table should filter for the users DOB .
justification: Covers data manipulation and an important process but less critical than previous searches.

name: Verify that a Neuven User can search the advanced generic search file for the email address of a worker.
testScript:
Given :
  • Logged on as a Neuven User.
When :
  • On the agency workers page.
Then :
  • Using the generic advanced search option, the table should filter for the users email address .
justification: Involves multiple components and data manipulation but less critical.

name: Verify that the show 'X ' entries drop down on the page displays and filter correctly.
testScript:
Given :
  • Logged in as a user with view agency works permission.
When :
  • Selecting a number from the selection of : '10' ,'25' ,'50','100'.
Then :
  • The page displays the correct number of rows in the table.
justification: Covers UI component functionality and data display but with a lesser impact.

name: Verify that the 'Previous' and 'Next' navigation buttons work.
testScript:
Given :
  • Logged on as a user with view agency works permission. 
When :
  • Selecting show 'XX' numbers of entries to be displayed in the table. 
Then :
  • Using the 'previous ' and 'next' button work and navigate through the list on entries.
justification: Covers UI component functionality but the field's criticality is low.

name: Verify that the legal information screen has the Company Status field when Editing an agency branch (cloned)
folder: UNO-1872 Neuven User - Agency - Update Existing Agency Branch
testScript:
Given :
  • Logged in as a Neuven user with agency permissions
When :
  • Go to agency > agency set up. 
  • Select an agency from the drop down
  • Click expand and then click edit.
Then :
  • The agency details display  a tab called legal information.
  • In the legal information tab there is a field for Company Status.
justification: Duplicate field check, important but less impactful than original.

name: Verify a NEUVEN USER can view the QR code Button on a direct workers profile.
testScript:
Given 
  • Logged in as a Neuven user with ‘Manage Direct Bank Worker’ permission
When
  • Direct Bank worker page
  • View a Direct Bank worker details
  • In the user details tab
Then
  • There is a ‘View QR Code’ button on the top right of the screen 
  • When clicked it displays a QR Code for that worker.
justification: Tests a UI element (QR code button), involves user permissions, but has lower business impact.

name: Verify a CLIENT USER can view the QR code Button on a direct worker's profile.
testScript:
Given 
  • Logged in as a Client user with ‘'View Direct Bank Worker’' or '‘Edit Direct Bank Worker’ permission
When 
  • Direct Bank worker page
  • View a Direct Bank worker details
  • In the user details tab

Then
  • There is a ‘View QR Code’ button on the top right of the screen 
  • When clicked it displays a QR Code for that worker. 
 
UNO-2473
justification: Tests a UI element (QR code button), involves user permissions, but has lower business impact.

name: Verify that if the client location has ‘Direct Bank Workers Only’ or ‘Both’ toggle on the client setting, no change is made to the T&A board page
testScript:
Given
  • Logged in as a Client User (With T&A permission)
  • T&A
  • T&A Board
  • Select Client Location
When 
  • Client location has ‘'Direct Bank Workers Only’' of ‘'Both’' Toggle on in client settings
Then 
Then below labels should be changed
  • The “Agency” column header “Worker Source”
  • The text in the Search box “Search Worker Source”
justification: Tests configuration toggle, involves data manipulation, but has lower business impact.

name: Verify that if the client location has ‘Agency Worker Only’ toggle on the client setting, no change is made to the T&A board page
testScript:
Given 
  • Logged in as a Client User (With T&A permission)
  • T&A
  • T&A Board
  • Select Client Location
When 
  • Client location has ‘'Agency Worker Only’' Toggle on in the client settings
Then
  • There will be no changes to the existing page
justification: Tests configuration toggle, involves data manipulation, but has lower business impact.

name: Verify that as a Direct Bank Worker the same QR code is displayed in the app as on the website
testScript:
Given 
  • A Direct Bank Worker is set up in Venneu.com
  • There is a QR code for that Direct Bank Worker 
  • The Direct Bank Worker has registered in Venneu APP
When 
  • In the worker profile section
  • And the upcoming shift details section 
Then
  • Show the same QR code of that worker
justification: Tests UI consistency, involves data display, but has lower business impact.

name: Verify Digital Tachograph Card Number allows both letters and numbers
testScript: • Verified that the field allows a combination of alphanumeric
justification: Tests a critical validation process, but does not cover integration points, security, or complex functionalities.

name: Verify Digital Tachograph Card Number allows maximum 25 characters
testScript: • Verified that the field does not allow you to enter more than 25 characters.
justification: Tests a critical validation process, but does not cover integration points, security, or complex functionalities.
